data.title: Apocryphal & Enochian Mythology
data.heroTitle: Hidden Wisdom of the Apocryphal & Enochian Traditions
data.description:
Explore the hidden wisdom of apocryphal texts and Enochian mysteries. Discover the Books of Enoch,
                the Watchers who fell from heaven, the Nephilim giants, and the angelic hierarchies revealed to
                the prophet Enoch. Journey through the seven heavens, learn the secret names of angels and demons,
                and uncover the esoteric knowledge forbidden from canonical scripture. These ancient texts preserve
                traditions of celestial rebellion, divine judgment, and secret wisdom that shaped Jewish mysticism,
                early Christianity, and Western esotericism for millennia.

sections.text: Hidden Wisdom of the Apocryphal & Enochian Traditions
� Book of Enoch: 10 Heavens as Dimensional Cascade

data.title: Aztec Mythology
data.heroTitle: The Mexica Cosmos
data.description: Explore the rich tapestry of Aztec mythology, from the creation myths to the cosmic battles between gods. Discover the feathered serpent Quetzalcoatl, the sun god Huitzilopochtli, the rain god Tlaloc, and the complex calendar system that guided Aztec civilization. Journey through tales of sacrifice, cosmic cycles, and the five suns that shaped the world.

data.title: Babylonian Mythology
data.heroTitle: The Tradition of Cosmic Order and Divine Kingship
data.description: Explore the ancient wisdom of Babylonian mythology, from the Enuma Elish creation epic to the Epic of Gilgamesh. Discover Marduk the creator god, Ishtar the goddess of love and war, and the seven planetary deities. Journey through tales of cosmic order, divine kingship, and the eternal struggle between chaos and civilization.

sections.text: The Tradition of Cosmic Order and Divine Kingship

data.title: Buddhist Mythology - Buddhist Mythology
data.heroTitle: The Path to Enlightenment & the Wheel of Dharma
data.description:
Explore the profound wisdom of Buddhist cosmology, from the enlightenment of the Buddha to the
                compassionate Bodhisattvas, from the 31 realms of existence to the eternal cycle of rebirth.
                Discover the path to liberation from suffering and the realization of ultimate truth.

sections.text: The Path to Enlightenment & the Wheel of Dharma
� Interdependent Origination - The Nature of Reality
� Death, Bardo & Rebirth - The Cycle Continues
ü™ú The Buddhist Path - Six Stages of Practice

data.title: Celtic Mythology
data.description: Explore the mystical traditions of Celtic mythology, from the ancient druids to the legendary heroes. Discover the Tuatha D√© Danann, the otherworldly realms, and the sacred cycles of nature. Journey through tales of magic, transformation, and the thin veil between the mortal and immortal worlds.

sections.text: The Tuatha D√© Danann & Celtic Deities

data.title: Chinese Mythology
data.heroTitle: The Way of Heaven and Earth
data.description:
Explore the rich tapestry of Chinese mythology spanning thousands of years, from the cosmic egg of Pangu
                to the Celestial Bureaucracy of the Jade Emperor. Discover the harmonious balance of Yin and Yang,
                the path to immortality through Taoist cultivation, and the divine figures who shaped Chinese civilization.

sections.text: The Way of Heaven and Earth

data.title: Christian & Gnostic Mythology - Universal Salvation
data.heroTitle: Christian & Gnostic Mythology
data.description: Explore the sacred mysteries of Christianity and Gnostic wisdom - from the Gospel of Universal Salvation to mystical Gnosis. Discover Christ as the Cosmic Redeemer who conquers death and Hades, the doctrine of Apokatastasis (restoration of all things), and the divine spark within every soul that returns to the Pleroma.

sections.text: � 12 Gates to the Kingdom: Dimensional Physics of Revelation

data.title: Egyptian Mythology
data.heroTitle: Ancient Egyptian Mythology & The Book of the Dead
data.description: Explore the timeless wisdom of Egyptian mythology, from the creation of the world to the journey through the afterlife. Discover Ra the sun god, Osiris the lord of the underworld, Isis the great mother, and the intricate beliefs about death and resurrection that shaped one of history's greatest civilizations.

sections.text: Ancient Egyptian Mythology & The Book of the Dead
Egyptian Cosmology & The Journey Through Duat
The Afterlife Journey (From Book of the Dead)
The Opening of the Mouth Ceremony
ìÇÄ The Egyptian Path: Initiate to Master
Stage 5: Sem Priest (Master of Mysteries) - Years 20-30

data.title: Greek Mythology
data.heroTitle: Greek Mythology & the Olympian Pantheon
data.description:
Explore the rich tapestry of Greek mythology, from the heights of Mount Olympus to the depths of Tartarus.
                Discover the twelve Olympians, legendary heroes, fearsome creatures, and the mysteries that shaped
                Western civilization for over a millennium.

sections.text: � Creation Myth - From Chaos to Cosmos
�Ô∏è Mount Olympus - Home of the Gods

data.title: Hindu Mythology
data.heroTitle: SanƒÅtana Dharma - The Eternal Way
data.description:
Explore the vast cosmos of Hindu mythology, from the Trimurti (Brahma, Vishnu, Shiva) to the countless
                devas and devis. Journey through the cycles of creation and destruction, the paths to moksha (liberation),
                and the sacred wisdom of the Vedas, Upanishads, and Bhagavad Gita.

data.title: Islamic Theology & Mysticism
data.heroTitle: The Abrahamic Monotheistic Tradition
data.description: Explore the sacred traditions of Islamic theology and mysticism, from the prophets and angels to the mystical path of Sufism. Discover the 99 Names of Allah, the spiritual journey of the soul, and the rich tradition of Islamic philosophy and metaphysics.

data.title: Japanese Mythology
data.heroTitle: The Sacred Stories of Shinto and the Kami
data.description:
Japanese mythology, recorded in the ancient chronicles Kojiki (712 CE) and Nihon Shoki (720 CE),
forms the foundation of Shinto belief. The myths tell of kami
(divine spirits) who created the Japanese islands and gave birth to the sun, moon, and natural world.
From the creation by Izanagi and Izanami to the adventures of storm god Susanoo, these tales explore
themes of purity, pollution, death, and the sacred nature of the land itself.

sections.text: The Sacred Stories of Shinto and the Kami

data.title: Jewish
data.heroTitle: The Leading Tradition of World Mythos Explorer
data.description: Explore the rich traditions of Jewish mysticism and theology, from the Hebrew Bible to Kabbalah. Discover the Sefirot, the angelic hierarchies, and the profound metaphysical teachings that have shaped Jewish thought for millennia.

sections.text: The Leading Tradition of World Mythos Explorer
� Enter the Kabbalah - The Mystical Core

data.title: Maya Mythology
data.heroTitle: The Cosmos of the Maya
data.description: Explore the cosmic wisdom of Mayan mythology, from the Popol Vuh creation epic to the Hero Twins' journey through Xibalba. Discover the maize god, the vision serpent, and the intricate calendar system that tracked cosmic cycles and prophetic time.

sections.text: The Popol Vuh - Book of the People

data.title: Native American Traditions
data.description: Explore the diverse spiritual traditions of Native American cultures, from creation stories to trickster tales. Discover the reverence for nature, the sacred medicine wheel, and the profound connection between all living things that defines indigenous wisdom.

data.title: Norse Mythology
data.heroTitle: The Sagas of Asgard and the World Tree
data.description:
Explore the mythology of the Norsemen - from the creation of the cosmos from Ymir's body to the
                prophesied destruction and rebirth at Ragnarok. Discover the wisdom of Odin, the might of Thor,
                the magic of Freyja, and the mysteries of the Nine Realms connected by Yggdrasil, the World Tree.

sections.text: The Sagas of Asgard and the World Tree

data.title: Persian/Zoroastrian Mythology
data.heroTitle: The Eternal Struggle Between Light and Darkness
data.description:
Explore one of humanity's oldest monotheistic faiths, founded by the prophet Zarathustra (Zoroaster).
                Zoroastrianism centers on the eternal cosmic struggle between Ahura Mazda (Wise Lord) and Angra Mainyu
                (Destructive Spirit), emphasizing the sacred fire, ethical dualism, and the path of good thoughts,
                good words, and good deeds.

sections.text: The Eternal Struggle Between Light and Darkness

data.title: Roman Mythology
data.heroTitle: The Pragmatic Religion of Empire and State
data.description:
Roman mythology represents one of history's most influential religious traditions, shaping
Western civilization for over a millennium. A pragmatic system of contracts between mortals and immortals designed to maintain the pax deorum (peace of the gods).

sections.text: The Pragmatic Religion of Empire and State

data.title: Sumerian Mythology
data.heroTitle: The Anunnaki & The First Civilization
data.description:
Sumerian civilization emerged in southern Mesopotamia around 4500 BCE, creating the world's first
                written language (cuneiform) and the oldest recorded mythology. The Sumerians believed the gods
                created humanity to serve them, building temples called ziggurats to house the divine. From the
                cosmic waters of Nammu to the dark underworld of Kur, explore the foundation of Mesopotamian religion.

sections.text: The Anunnaki - Gods of Heaven and Earth
Sumerian Cosmology & The Land of No Return
3. Entering the Land of No Return
íÄ≠ The Sumerian Path: Temple Servant to Ensi

data.title: Yoruba/African Mythology
data.heroTitle: The Way of the Orisha
data.description: Explore one of the world's most vibrant and enduring spiritual traditions, originating among the Yoruba people of West Africa (present-day Nigeria, Benin, and Togo). Yoruba religion centers on the worship of the Orisha - divine spirits who serve as intermediaries between humanity and Olodumare, the Supreme Creator. This ancient tradition has spread across the globe through the African diaspora, flourishing as Santeria, Candomble, Vodou, and other syncretic faiths.

sections.text: Orun and Aye - Heaven and Earth
